attributes.action: Create a National Screening Program for Prostate Cancer
attributes.additional_details:
Over 52000 men are diagnoses and over 12000 die of prostate cancer a year, a large number of these deaths happen and the men see no symptoms.  An automatic PSA test of men over the age of 50, although not the best answer will be a step in the right direction.

Looking at the numbers related to other National screening program, 3200 cervical cancer cases are found a year and 57000 breast cancer cases, it seems prostate cancer has been left behind and it's about time this is corrected.
attributes.background: As part of the over 50's NHS Health Check automatically include a PSA test for all men.

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament are not directly responsible for the NHS Health Check, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Fund routine prostate cancer screening tests for all men over 40: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/642176
